      Oops, we can't find your location

      First, try refreshing the page and clicking Current Location again. Make sure you click Allow or Grant Permissions if your browser asks for your location. If your browser doesn't ask you, try these steps:

      1. At the top of your Chrome window, near the web address, click the green lock labeled Secure.
      2. In the window that pops up, make sure Location is set to Ask or Allow.
      3. You're good to go! Reload this Yelp page and try your search again.

      If you're still having trouble, check out Google's support page. You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      1. At the top of your Opera window, near the web address, you should see a gray location pin. Click it.
      2. In the window that pops up, click Clear This Setting
      3. You're good to go! Reload this Yelp page and try your search again.

      If you're still having trouble, check out Opera's support page. You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      1. Click Safari in the Menu Bar at the top of the screen, then Preferences.
      2. Click the Privacy tab.
      3. Under Website use of location services, click Prompt for each website once each day or Prompt for each website one time only.
      4. MacOS may now prompt you to enable Location Services. If it does, follow its instructions to enable Location Services for Safari.
      5. Close the Privacy menu and refresh the page. Try using Current Location search again. If it works, great! If not, read on for more instructions.
      6. Back in the Privacy dialog, Click Manage Website Data... and type yelp.com into the search bar.
      7. Click the yelp.com entry and click Remove.
      8. You're good to go! Close the Settings tab, reload this Yelp page, and try your search again.

      If you're still having trouble, check out Safari's support page. You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      1. At the top of your Firefox window, to the left of the web address, you should see a green lock. Click it.
      2. In the window that pops up, you should see Blocked or Blocked Temporarily next to Access Your Location. Click the x next to this line.
      3. You're good to go! Refresh this Yelp page and try your search again.

      If you're still having trouble, check out Firefox's support page. You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      1. Click the gear in the upper-right hand corner of the window, then Internet options.
      2. Click the Privacy tab in the new window that just appeared.
      3. Uncheck the box labeled Never allow websites to request your physical location if it's already checked.
      4. Click the button labeled Clear Sites.
      5. You're good to go! Click OK, then refresh this Yelp page and try your search again.

      You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      1. At the top-right hand corner of the window, click the button with three dots on it, then Settings.
      2. Click Choose what to clear underneath Clear browsing data.
      3. Click Show more, then make sure only the box labeled Location permissions is checked.
      4. Click Clear.
      5. You're good to go! Refresh this Yelp page and try your search again.

      You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      Oops! We don't recognize the web browser you're currently using. Try checking the browser's help menu, or searching the Web for instructions to turn on HTML5 Geolocation for your browser. You can also search near a city, place, or address instead.

      Something broke and we're not sure what. Try again later, or search near a city, place, or address instead.
      We couldn't find you quickly enough! Try again later, or search near a city, place, or address instead.
      We couldn't find an accurate position. If you're using a laptop or tablet, try moving it somewhere else and give it another go. Or, search near a city, place, or address instead.

      7
      335 S Frontage Rd
      Centerville, UT 84014
      (801) 295-5081

      It's obvious having grown up in the community that Dave's is here to stay. The only other competitor in business as long is Ray's. All the other shops have been re-branded re-managed or just closed. A solid sign of a great local family run business is the fact it is still around! It is super easy to get to look for the lit palm trees :) Service; oh my lord talk about nothing but honest mechanics in the shop. It's a tight knit group of the friendliest mechanics who take pride in their work. What I loved about my repair experience was the philosophy of the business. Cars are like medical patients, sure another shop in town might write a prescription or worse dig into an issue without diagnosing the symptoms. It's kinda funny these people are mad about the 'price constantly changing'. I think they are use to shady shops or don't know the cost of responsible ownership. It is constantly changing because these guys don't skimp. Detailed photos of the actual issues found while diagnosing my Nissan Versa MIL light. Text updates with the repairs and Miles' wonderful dedication to ensuring I was happy and my car fixed. Call them up, check them out in person. I promise you will see what I saw. And hopefully you will be here singing praises too.

      Competent enough but felt I was being upcharged. Also I felt I was being talked down to by the actual mechanic when inquiring about details on the car. Treated me like I was an annoyance.

      They've always been up-front about costs and delivered the promised experience. It is always tough to have to take your car in to be fixed, but Dave's Auto has always given us top-notch work, and made unexpected car troubles a pleasant experience.

      These guys are great! The customer service is top notch which is hard to find anymore. When I visited their shop they showed/explained to me every part that needed replaced/rebuilt. They fixed my BMW and let me know of every affordable option. I will definitely return and recommend them to every one.

      I've taken my vehicles here for regular maintenance and servicing. Was greeted promptly and felt like they took the time to properly diagnose the problem. Appreciated the fact they called before performing any maintenance to let me know of costs. Overall great experience and would recommend especially if you are looking for a good trustworthy mechanic as it seems harder to come by them now a days.

      I recently took my 2006 Volvo into Dave's due to a noise coming from the front right tire and the AC blowing warm after 15 minutes. I received a call from Dave's telling me they had identified the issue and also found another problem with the timing belt to the tune of about $2,000. I took their advice, paid and had the work done. I picked my car up and to my surprise after 15 minutes the AC began running hot again and the noise was still there. I also noticed a huge problem with the transmission at this point so I decided to take it to Les Schwab to fix the noise. $600 later they replaced a bearing which Dave claimed to do but apparently they like to replace the wrong one and charge you. After my AC continued running hot I took my car back to Dave's and explained that again after 15 minutes it's warm. I get a call saying it's blowing a cool 68 degrees and to pick it up which I do and guess what? Blows cold for 15 and then gets hot. I took it in for a third time and the manager Keith had the audacity to charge me $89 for a diagnostic on an issue they hadn't resolved. Needless to say we had some pretty heated words and I left my car. I received a call from Dave and it was the most unprofessional business experience of my life. He yelled, I yelled back and he put me on hold twice while I was in mid sentence. Dave then quoted me another almost $2k. At this point I was done and gave in to have the work done and felt entirely taken advantage of. I have since received a call from Dave asking me to take down my yelp review since the issue was fixed after 3 visits and $4600 including the work I had to get elsewhere because they failed. Not a chance, this is the worst mechanic and business I have ever dealt with. I will make sure every social media and review site receives feedback from me to save anyone else from this sham. Please keep away from this place.

      While the work gets done, the process is horrible. They always underbid on the estimate to get your business - then continually add in additional costs they "find" as the work progresses. By the time you're done you are almost twice the price of the original quote. Even when they tell you the job is complete and give you a final price they come up with more costs when you pick up the vehicle. Save yourself a lot of time and money and go anywhere else!

      Dave’s Auto Center

        10/3/2016 Updated review

        It's obvious having grown up in the community that Dave's is here to stay. The only other competitor in business as long is Ray's. All the other shops have been re-branded re-managed or just closed. A solid sign of a great local family run business is the fact it is still around!

        It is super easy to get to look for the lit palm trees :)

        Service; oh my lord talk about nothing but honest mechanics in the shop. It's a tight knit group of the friendliest mechanics who take pride in their work.

        What I loved about my repair experience was the philosophy of the business. Cars are like medical patients, sure another shop in town might write a prescription or worse dig into an issue without diagnosing the symptoms.

        It's kinda funny these people are mad about the 'price constantly changing'. I think they are use to shady shops or don't know the cost of responsible ownership. It is constantly changing because these guys don't skimp.

        Detailed photos of the actual issues found while diagnosing my Nissan Versa MIL light. Text updates with the repairs and Miles' wonderful dedication to ensuring I was happy and my car fixed.

        Call them up, check them out in person.
        I promise you will see what I saw.

        And hopefully you will be here singing praises too.

        Josh T. and 10 others voted for this review

Reason being emissions are state specific and a broken muffler isn't a engine rebuild. They might have said it should pass, and probably even told he customer who explains they went elsewhere but not for what. I'm betting it was the fried catalytic converter they created blowing the motor to dust. I do not get why you blame these wonderful guys for your cheapness and irresponsible ownership.

        Call them up, check them out in person.

        6/28/2014

        I recently took my 2006 Volvo into Dave's due to a noise coming from the front right tire and the AC blowing warm after 15 minutes. I received a call from Dave's telling me they had identified the issue and also found another problem with the timing belt to the tune of about $2,000. I took their advice, paid and had the work done. I picked my car up and to my surprise after 15 minutes the AC began running hot again and the noise was still there. I also noticed a huge problem with the transmission at this point so I decided to take it to Les Schwab to fix the noise. $600 later they replaced a bearing which Dave claimed to do but apparently they like to replace the wrong one and charge you. After my AC continued running hot I took my car back to Dave's and explained that again after 15 minutes it's warm. I get a call saying it's blowing a cool 68 degrees and to pick it up which I do and guess what? Blows cold for 15 and then gets hot. I took it in for a third time and the manager Keith had the audacity to charge me $89 for a diagnostic on an issue they hadn't resolved. Needless to say we had some pretty heated words and I left my car. I received a call from Dave and it was the most unprofessional business experience of my life. He yelled, I yelled back and he put me on hold twice while I was in mid sentence. Dave then quoted me another almost $2k. At this point I was done and gave in to have the work done and felt entirely taken advantage of. I have since received a call from Dave asking me to take down my yelp review since the issue was fixed after 3 visits and $4600 including the work I had to get elsewhere because they failed. Not a chance, this is the worst mechanic and business I have ever dealt with. I will make sure every social media and review site receives feedback from me to save anyone else from this sham. Please keep away from this place.

        Business Customer Service
        5/15/2014 Hi G. S., sorry to hear that you had an unsatisfactory experience. I cannot find a G. S. in our… Hi G. S., sorry to hear that you had an unsatisfactory experience. I cannot find a G. S. in our customer data base to contact you directly. If we ever do find additional problems with a vehicle, it is a Utah law that the quote cannot be raised more than 10% without customer authorization. It is our policy to always call our customers to discuss with them if there is any additional unforeseen recommended work. Please call Alan, our general manager, 801-295-5081, and you will find us very willing to review your repair order with you and work with you to make sure you are a satisfied customer. Read more

      From the business

      Specialties

      Come try the best equipped shop in the state!  We service all makes and models, have trained diesel specialists, and a full in house CNC machine shop.

      Our technicians are ASE Master certified and we specialize in import autos as well CNG conversions/repair. We can work with all insurance companies and our technicians are factory trained, and receive ongoing training every year. We have won multiple awards as the best equipped shop in Utah.

      Find out what all of Davis County knows, take your car to Dave's for any and all automotive work!

      We pledge to exceed your expectations of quality customer service and satisfaction.

      History

      Established in 1990.

      Having worked in the auto repair industry all his life, Miles decided to strike out on his own and open Dave's Auto Center. He already had a large group of clients who trusted his work ethic, and so the business has flourished. He employs family and trusted ASE certified technicians to help him provide the highest quality of service. Between all the technicians, there is over 100 years of experience at the shop.

      Meet the Business Owner

      Miles B.
      Business Owner

      Miles has been in the car business since he was 2 years old! He tagged along with his mother when she went to work at an auto repair facility. He may even have grease in his blood. He has attended Weber State's auto program, but feels the best experience has been the hands on over the years.

      Report
